Namespace FunctionalLink.Next

Classes

EnumerableExtensions

A few extra methods for composing with Linq.

Failure<T>

A failure wrapper that is implicitly convertable to a Result. This type is not intended to be constructed manually. It exists entirely, to reduce the amount of code required to construct Results.

GlobalLink

If enabled, this class provides constructors for all of the types in the library without needing to fully qualify the type. Using this is completely optional, but does create very clean looking code.

None

None is used to declare a None state for an Option. This type is implicitly convertible to an Option.

ObjectExtensions

A few extensions that aid in functional composition.

Option

A static class for constructing Options in a more explicit way, if desired.

Option<T>

The Option class works like a Nullable<T>, but for reference types as well as primitive types. It is intended to replace the use of null as a value.

Result

A static class for constructing Results in a more explicit way, if desired.

Result<T>

This version of the Result type assumes the failure state will be a string. This is often the case and reduced the amount of type information required on function signatures

Result<T, TFailure>

The result type is used to eliminate the need for throwing exceptions. The idea is that a function that returns a result will either return a successful value or an error value. The methods of the Result type help you compose and deconstruct this information.

ResultExtensions

All behavior for the Result types are defined here.

Success<T>

A generic success wrapper that is implicitly convertable to a Result
